dublin_core.dcvalue: Physical activity has many benefits for older adults however motivating older adults to engage in and maintain optimal levels of physical activity can be challenging for health care providers A comprehensive literature review was performed to determine whether any evidence based methods of delivery or particular content for targeted messaging exist that result in actual improvements in physical activity of older adults Findings of the review demonstrate that messaging directed toward older adults to be physically active resulted in improvements in physical activity up to 1 year Across studies many different modes of message delivery were shown to be effective Message content whether tailored or not resulted in significant increases in physical activity There is evidence to support the use of environmentally mediated messaging i e local walking paths for stronger results Targeting the client s stage of change having an activity partner if preferred and scheduling physical activity also contribute to improved effects
